title: 103_hr3060
content: The Act may be cited as the "Electronic Funds Transfer Federal Salary Act" and aims to ensure safe, economical, and effective payroll administration. The Act, known as the "Electronic Funds Transfer Federal Salary Act," amends Section 3332 of title 31, United States Code, defining financial organizations and authorizing the Secretary of the Treasury to require electronic transfers for employee pay if deemed practical and beneficial for economy or effectiveness. The Secretary may require electronic transfers for employee pay if practical and establish safeguards over public funds. Employees subject to the regulation must designate a financial organization to receive payments, and the Secretary may not charge transfer fees. The Secretary cannot charge transfer fees to financial organizations or employees for payments made under this section. Employees earning less than $20,000 annually can request exemption from the requirements. National security provisions are not affected by this section. The Director of the Central Intelligence Agency can exempt the agency and its employees from certain regulations if compliance would risk disclosing intelligence sources or compromise security. Acceptance of payment authorized by the Secretary constitutes full acquittance by the United States. Payment authorized by the Secretary constitutes full acquittance by the United States for any amount due to a person, excluding employee pay, and can be made in any manner specified by the Secretary. Additionally, technical and conforming amendments are made to Section 3332 of title 31, United States Code.
